name: biobb_ml RegressionNeuralNetwork
title: Wrapper of the TensorFlow Keras Sequential method.
description: Trains and tests a given dataset and save the complete model for a Neural Network Regression. Visit the Sequential documentation page in the TensorFlow Keras official website for further information.

output_model_path.description: Path to the output model file

file_formats.description: Path to the output model file

output_test_table_path.description: Path to the test table file

file_formats.description: Path to the test table file

features.description: Independent variables or columns from your dataset you want to train. You can specify either a list of columns names from your input dataset, a list of columns indexes or a range of columns indexes. Formats: { "columns": ["column1", "column2"] } or { "indexes": [0, 2, 3, 10, 11, 17] } or { "range": [[0, 20], [50, 102]] }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked.

target.description: Dependent variable you want to predict from your dataset. You can specify either a column name or a column index. Formats: { "column": "column3" } or { "index": 21 }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked.

weight.description: Weight variable from your dataset. You can specify either a column name or a column index. Formats: { "column": "column3" } or { "index": 21 }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked.

validation_size.description: Represents the proportion of the dataset to include in the validation split. It should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

test_size.description: Represents the proportion of the dataset to include in the test split. It should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

hidden_layers.description: List of dictionaries with hidden layers values. Format: [ { 'size': 50, 'activation': 'relu' } ].

output_layer_activation.description: Activation function to use in the output layer.

property_formats.name: relu
property_formats.description: Applies the rectified linear unit activation function

property_formats.name: softmax
property_formats.description: Softmax converts a real vector to a vector of categorical probabilities

property_formats.name: Adadelta
property_formats.description: Adadelta optimization is a stochastic gradient descent method that is based on adaptive learning rate per dimension to address two drawbacks: the continual decay of learning rates throughout training and the need for a manually selected global learning rate

property_formats.name: Adagrad
property_formats.description: Adagrad is an optimizer with parameter-specific learning rates; which are adapted relative to how frequently a parameter gets updated during training. The more updates a parameter receives; the smaller the updates

property_formats.name: Adam
property_formats.description: Adam optimization is a stochastic gradient descent method that is based on adaptive estimation of first-order and second-order moments

property_formats.name: Adamax
property_formats.description: It is a variant of Adam based on the infinity norm. Default parameters follow those provided in the paper. Adamax is sometimes superior to adam; specially in models with embeddings

property_formats.name: Ftrl
property_formats.description: Optimizer that implements the FTRL algorithm

property_formats.name: Nadam
property_formats.description: Much like Adam is essentially RMSprop with momentum; Nadam is Adam with Nesterov momentum

property_formats.name: RMSprop
property_formats.description: Optimizer that implements the RMSprop algorithm

learning_rate.description: Determines the step size at each iteration while moving toward a minimum of a loss function

batch_size.description: Number of samples per gradient update.

max_epochs.description: Number of epochs to train the model. As the early stopping is enabled, this is a maximum.

random_state.description: Controls the shuffling applied to the data before applying the split. .

scale.description: Whether or not to scale the input dataset.

restart.description: Do not execute if output files exist.
